org.orgName: District Court for the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory

div1.p: District Court for the Fourth Judicial District of Washington Territory, Holding Terms at Spokane Falls.
The Territory of Washington, vs. George Smith
George Smith is Accused by the Grand Jury of the Territory of Washington, for the County of Spokane and by this indictment, of the crime of Grand Larceny

Committed as follows: The said George Smith on the 31st day of May, 1888 in the county of Spokane in the District aforesaid did time and then unlaw- fully and feloneously tried to take and carry away our leather valise of the value of two dollars. One coat of the value of twenty dollars one light coat and vest of the value of two and one half dollars. One pair of pants of the value of eight dollars, 6 six pair of cotton socks of the value of sixty cents, six white neck ties of the value of sixty-cents one blue neck tie of the value of one dollar two suits of under clothes of the value of four dollars, eight photograph pictures of the value of six dollars, Four tin type pictures of the value of fifty-cents four white shirts of the value of three (3) dollars. One pair of cuff buttons of the value of five dollars. And another pair of cuff buttons of the value od one and one haldf dollars. One of the value of thgree dollars. One pair of of the value of five cents, all of the personal goods and property of Charles D. Colwoll
Dated at Spokane Falls, in the District aforesaid the 2nd day of July A.D., 1888 W C Jones Prosecuting Attorney.
Names of all the witnesses examined and who testified before the Grand Jury on the finding of thi indictment. Charles D Colwell. Charles M Frank L. Graves.
2251 Territory of Washington vs George Smith Indictment for Grand Larceny
A TRUE BILL. S. Heath Foreman of the Grand Jury.
Presented to the Court by the Foreman of the Grand Jury in their presence and filed this 22 day of June A.D., 1888 D Aclement Clerk.
We the jury in the case of the Territory of Washington plaintiff against George Smith defendant find the defendant guilty of pettit Larceny D.F.C Abel Forman
